segment.source: Use the Exclusion Item dialog box to assign or change a mapping rule and to assign or change an expression for exclusion.
segment.target: Use the Exclusion Item dialog box to assign or change a mapping rule and to assign or change an expression for exclusion.

segment.source: This dialog box contains the following elements.
segment.target: This dialog box contains the following elements.

segment.source: Adding files from an excluded directory to the virtual files system is not supported.
segment.target: Adding files from an excluded directory to the virtual files system is not supported.

segment.source: Use to specify variable name that the Application Virtualization Sequencer will exclude if encountered while parsing virtual file system items or virtual registry items.
segment.target: Use to specify variable name that the Application Virtualization Sequencer will exclude if encountered while parsing virtual file system items or virtual registry items.

segment.source: Use to select the mapping rules the Application Virtualization Sequencer will apply to parse items in the virtual file system or virtual registry.
segment.target: Use to select the mapping rules the Application Virtualization Sequencer will apply to parse items in the virtual file system or virtual registry.

segment.source: One of the following values can occur:
segment.target: One of the following values can occur:

segment.source: VRG—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in the virtual registry.
segment.target: VRG—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in the virtual registry.

segment.source: VFS—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in the virtual file system.
segment.target: VFS—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in the virtual file system.

segment.source: VRG & VFS—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in either the virtual file system or the virtual registry.
segment.target: VRG & VFS—Specifies that this mapping rule applies when parsing an item in either the virtual file system or the virtual registry.
